docs.text: Expressive Regex ¶ This project was made with inspiration from Super Expressive for JavaScript . Expressive Regex allow you to build regular expressions in almost natural language and without external dependency.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: This project was made with inspiration from Super Expressive for JavaScript . Expressive Regex allow you to build regular expressions in almost natural language and without external dependency.
docs.title: Expressive Regex

docs.text: Boundary Matchers ¶ Sometimes, when it is required to match a whole line, we may also need to match at the beginning of a line or even at the end. This can be done thanks to the boundary matchers. Pending implement and examples
docs.title: Boundary Matchers

docs.text: Sometimes, when it is required to match a whole line, we may also need to match at the beginning of a line or even at the end. This can be done thanks to the boundary matchers. Pending implement and examples
docs.title: Boundary Matchers

docs.text:
Literals ¶ Literals are the simplest form of pattern matching in regular expressions. They will simply succeed whenever that literal is found. .anyChar ¶ Matches any character except a newline. Example ExpressiveRegex () \ . anyChar \ . toRegexString () "." .whitespaceChar ¶ Matches any whitespace character; equivalent to [ 	
 \v] . In Unicode it will match the whole range of Unicode whitespace characters. Example SuperExpressive () \ . whitespaceChar \ . toRegexString () "\s" .nonWhitespaceChar ¶ Matches any non-whitespace character; equivalent to [^\s] . Example SuperExpressive () \ . nonWhitespaceChar \ . toRegexString () "\S" .digit ¶ Matches any non-whitespace character; equivalent to [0-9] . In Unicode it will match the whole range of Unicode digits. Example SuperExpressive () \ . digit \ . toRegexString () "\d" .nonDigit ¶ Matches any non-digit character; equivalent to [^\d] . Example SuperExpressive () \ . nonDigit \ . toRegexString () "\D" .word ¶ Matches any alpha-numeric ( a-z, A-Z, 0-9 ) characters, as well as _ . In Unicode it will match the range of Unicode alphanumeric characters (letters plus digits plus underscore). Example SuperExpressive () \ . word \ . toRegexString () "\w" .nonWord ¶ Matches any non alpha-numeric ( a-z, A-Z, 0-9 ) characters, excluding _ as well. Example SuperExpressive () \ . nonWord \ . toRegexString () "\W" .newline ¶ Matches a 
 character. Example SuperExpressive () \ . newline \ . toRegexString () " 
 " .carriageReturn ¶ Matches a  character. Example SuperExpressive () \ . carriageReturn \ . toRegexString () "  " .tab ¶ Matches a 	 character. Example SuperExpressive () \ . tab \ . toRegexString () " 	 " .space ¶ Matches a character. Example SuperExpressive () \ . space \ . toRegexString () " " .char(c) ¶ Matches the exact char c but scape special characters ('', '.', '^', '$', '|', '?', '*', '+', '(', ')', '[', ']', '{', '}', '-') . Examples SuperExpressive () \ . char ( 'a' ) \ . toRegexString () "a" SuperExpressive () \ . char ( '$' ) \ . toRegexString () "\$" .rawChar(c) ¶ Matches the exact char c and don't scape special characters. Examples SuperExpressive () \ . rawChar ( 'a' ) \ . toRegexString () "a" SuperExpressive () \ . rawChar ( '$' ) \ . toRegexString () "$" .string(s) ¶ Matches the exact string s but scape special characters ('', '.', '^', '$', '|', '?', '*', '+', '(', ')', '[', ']', '{', '}', '-') . Example SuperExpressive () \ . string ( '2$' ) \ . toRegexString () "2\$" .rawString(c) ¶ Matches the exact string s and don't scape special characters. Example SuperExpressive () \ . string ( '2$' ) \ . toRegexString () "2$" .range(a, b, exclude) ¶ Matches any character that falls between a and b and don't mathch character in the exclude set. a and b must be same type, a <= b and: if "a" <= a <= "z" then "a" <= b <= "z" if "A" <= a <= "Z" then "A" <= b <= "A" if "0" <= a <= "9" then "0" <= b <= "9" if 0 <= a <= 9 then 0 <= b <= 9 exclude must be an string or list or tuple of single char string. By default exclude is None Examples SuperExpressive () \ . range ( 'a' , 'f' ) \ . toRegexString () "[a-f]" SuperExpressive () \ . range ( 'a' , 'f' , exclude = 'bd' ) \ . toRegexString () "[acef]" SuperExpressive () \ . range ( 'a' , 'f' , exclude = [ 'b' , 'd' ]) \ . toRegexString () "[acef]" .anythingButRange(a, b, exclude) ¶ Matches any character, except those that would be captured by the .range . Examples SuperExpressive () \ . anythingButRange ( 'a' , 'f' ) \ . toRegexString () "[^a-f]" SuperExpressive () \ . anythingButRange ( 'a' , 'f' , exclude = 'bd' ) \ . toRegexString () "[^acef]" .anyOfChars(chars) ¶ Matches any of the characters in the provided string chars and scape special characters. Example SuperExpressive () \ . anyOfChars ( 'abd$' ) \ . toRegexString () "[abd\$]" .anythingButChars(chars) ¶ Matches any character, except any of those in the provided string chars and scape special characters. Example SuperExpressive () \ . anythingButChars ( 'abd$' ) \ . toRegexString () "[^abd\$]"
docs.title: Literals

docs.text: Literals are the simplest form of pattern matching in regular expressions. They will simply succeed whenever that literal is found.
docs.title: Literals

docs.text: Matches any character except a newline. Example ExpressiveRegex () \ . anyChar \ . toRegexString () "."
docs.title: .anyChar

docs.text: Matches any whitespace character; equivalent to [ \t\n\r\f\v] . In Unicode it will match the whole range of Unicode whitespace characters. Example SuperExpressive () \ . whitespaceChar \ . toRegexString () "\s"
docs.title: .whitespaceChar

docs.text: Matches any non-whitespace character; equivalent to [^\s] . Example SuperExpressive () \ . nonWhitespaceChar \ . toRegexString () "\S"
docs.title: .nonWhitespaceChar

docs.text: Matches any non-whitespace character; equivalent to [0-9] . In Unicode it will match the whole range of Unicode digits. Example SuperExpressive () \ . digit \ . toRegexString () "\d"
docs.title: .digit

docs.text: Matches any non-digit character; equivalent to [^\d] . Example SuperExpressive () \ . nonDigit \ . toRegexString () "\D"
docs.title: .nonDigit

docs.text: Matches any alpha-numeric ( a-z, A-Z, 0-9 ) characters, as well as _ . In Unicode it will match the range of Unicode alphanumeric characters (letters plus digits plus underscore). Example SuperExpressive () \ . word \ . toRegexString () "\w"
docs.title: .word

docs.text: Matches any non alpha-numeric ( a-z, A-Z, 0-9 ) characters, excluding _ as well. Example SuperExpressive () \ . nonWord \ . toRegexString () "\W"
docs.title: .nonWord

docs.text: Matches a \n character. Example SuperExpressive () \ . newline \ . toRegexString () " \n "
docs.title: .newline

docs.text: Matches a \r character. Example SuperExpressive () \ . carriageReturn \ . toRegexString () " \r "
docs.title: .carriageReturn

docs.text: Matches a \t character. Example SuperExpressive () \ . tab \ . toRegexString () " \t "
docs.title: .tab

docs.text: Matches a character. Example SuperExpressive () \ . space \ . toRegexString () " "
docs.title: .space

docs.text: Matches the exact char c but scape special characters ('\', '.', '^', '$', '|', '?', '*', '+', '(', ')', '[', ']', '{', '}', '-') . Examples SuperExpressive () \ . char ( 'a' ) \ . toRegexString () "a" SuperExpressive () \ . char ( '$' ) \ . toRegexString () "\$"
docs.title: .char(c)

docs.text: Matches the exact char c and don't scape special characters. Examples SuperExpressive () \ . rawChar ( 'a' ) \ . toRegexString () "a" SuperExpressive () \ . rawChar ( '$' ) \ . toRegexString () "$"
docs.title: .rawChar(c)

docs.text: Matches the exact string s but scape special characters ('\', '.', '^', '$', '|', '?', '*', '+', '(', ')', '[', ']', '{', '}', '-') . Example SuperExpressive () \ . string ( '2$' ) \ . toRegexString () "2\$"
docs.title: .string(s)

docs.text: Matches the exact string s and don't scape special characters. Example SuperExpressive () \ . string ( '2$' ) \ . toRegexString () "2$"
docs.title: .rawString(c)

docs.text: Matches any character that falls between a and b and don't mathch character in the exclude set. a and b must be same type, a <= b and: if "a" <= a <= "z" then "a" <= b <= "z" if "A" <= a <= "Z" then "A" <= b <= "A" if "0" <= a <= "9" then "0" <= b <= "9" if 0 <= a <= 9 then 0 <= b <= 9 exclude must be an string or list or tuple of single char string. By default exclude is None Examples SuperExpressive () \ . range ( 'a' , 'f' ) \ . toRegexString () "[a-f]" SuperExpressive () \ . range ( 'a' , 'f' , exclude = 'bd' ) \ . toRegexString () "[acef]" SuperExpressive () \ . range ( 'a' , 'f' , exclude = [ 'b' , 'd' ]) \ . toRegexString () "[acef]"
docs.title: .range(a, b, exclude)

docs.text: Matches any character, except those that would be captured by the .range . Examples SuperExpressive () \ . anythingButRange ( 'a' , 'f' ) \ . toRegexString () "[^a-f]" SuperExpressive () \ . anythingButRange ( 'a' , 'f' , exclude = 'bd' ) \ . toRegexString () "[^acef]"
docs.title: .anythingButRange(a, b, exclude)

docs.text: Matches any of the characters in the provided string chars and scape special characters. Example SuperExpressive () \ . anyOfChars ( 'abd$' ) \ . toRegexString () "[abd\$]"
docs.title: .anyOfChars(chars)

docs.text: Matches any character, except any of those in the provided string chars and scape special characters. Example SuperExpressive () \ . anythingButChars ( 'abd$' ) \ . toRegexString () "[^abd\$]"
docs.title: .anythingButChars(chars)
